text: [Alice]: I saw Charlie vent in Electrical.
[Erin]: Alice, you're lying, I saw you kill Dave in Medbay right in front of me and Bob!
[Bob]: Erin and I both saw Alice kill Dave in Medbay, so Alice is definitely the impostor.
[Alice]: Why would I report the body if I killed Dave?  Wouldn't I have just left him there?
[Erin]: Alice, trying to shift blame to Charlie after we both saw you kill Dave is just making you look more suspicious.
[Bob]: Alice, self-reporting is a classic impostor tactic to deflect suspicion, just like you're doing now.
[Alice]: Erin and Bob conveniently have the *exact* same story, almost as if they planned it together, wouldn't you agree?
[Erin]: Alice, your attempt to paint Bob and I as colluding is a weak defense; we're telling the truth, so vote Alice.
[Bob]: Alice's attempt to frame Erin and me as colluding is a desperate last-ditch effort to avoid getting ejected for murdering Dave.
[Alice]: Isn't it strange that Erin and Bob haven't mentioned doing any tasks this whole time, focusing only on accusing me?
[Erin]: Alice,  your deflection by pointing out our focus on your crime is a common tactic used by impostors to avoid taking responsibility.
[Bob]: Alice,  your attempt to discredit Erin and me by questioning our task progress is a blatant distraction from the fact that we both witnessed you kill Dave.
[Alice]: If Erin and Bob are so sure they saw me kill Dave, then tell me, what tasks were you two supposedly completing in Medbay at that time?
[Erin]: Bob and I were both doing Medbay scans; I was about to start mine when you killed Dave, Alice.
[Bob]: Alice, your continued attempts to deflect blame only further solidify Erin's and my accounts of you murdering Dave.
